question: The Tibetan ethnic group is mainly distributed in ____.
Apart from the Tibet Autonomous Region, Tibetans are also mainly distributed in Qinghai, Gansu, Sichuan, and ____ provinces/regions.
Tibetan people call themselves ____.
The Tibetan people living in the eastern parts of Tibet and western Sichuan call themselves ____.
The Tibetan people living in the Ali region of Tibet refer to themselves as ____.
The Tibetan people who call themselves 'Anduo Wa' are distributed in ____.
The Tibetan people who call themselves 'Zangba' live in the ____ region.
The people living in the Ü-Tsang region among the Tibetan ethnic group refer to themselves as ____.
The Tibetan people are generally referred to as ____.
The Tibetan language belongs to the ____ language branch of the Sino-Tibetan language family.
Tibetan is divided into three dialects by region: Ü-Tsang, ____, and Amdo.
The Tibetan ____ and the Khams dialect both have tones.
The Tibetan dialect that does not include tones is ____.
A characteristic of the Amdo dialect of the Tibetan language is ____.
options: The standard language is based on the central dialect

question: The Tibetan script was created in the early ____ century AD.
The Tibetan script mainly includes ____ consonant letters.
Tibetan script is a writing system with ____ vowel symbols.
Tibetan scripts mainly include 'uchen,' which are regular script, and '____,' which are cursive script.
Tibetan script is written from left to right using ____ and ink.
The topographical features of areas inhabited by Tibetan populations are____.
The terrain of areas inhabited by Tibetan communities is described as ____.
The Tibetan people mainly live on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau at an altitude of approximately ____ meters.
Qilian Mountain, Kunlun Mountain, Tanggula Mountain, Gangdise Mountain, Himalayas and other mountain ranges stretch across the entire areas of Qinghai and Tibet from ____ to the east.
Qilian Mountains, Kunlun Mountains, Tanggula Mountains, Gangdise Mountains, Himalayas, etc., stretch from west to east, spanning ____ and the entire territory of Tibet.
The mountain ranges of Qilian Mountains, Kunlun Mountains, ____ Mountains, Gangdise Mountains, Himalayas, etc., stretch across the entirety of Qinghai and Tibet from west to east.
The Qilian Mountains, Kunlun Mountains, Tanggula Mountains, Gangdise Mountains, Himalayas and other mountain ranges stretch from west to east across Qinghai and the entire territory of ____.
Qilian Mountains, Kunlun Mountains, Tanggula Mountains, Gangdise Mountains, and ____ Mountains stretch across the entirety of Qinghai and Tibet from west to east.
One of the Tibetan inhabited areas, the Hengduan Mountains run through Sichuan and the ____ western region.
One of the geographical features of the Hengduan Mountains, a region inhabited by Tibetans, is____.
options: High in the east and low in the west
High in the west and low in the east
High in the south and low in the north
High in the north and low in the south
answer: High in the north and low in the south

question: Mount Everest is located between China and ____.
The altitude of Mount Everest is ____ meters.
Mount Everest is considered the ____ mountain in the world.
The Yellow River originates from the foothills of the Yaladarze Mountain in the ____ Mountains within Qinghai.
The northern source of the Yangtze River is in ____ Mountain, and the southern source is at the foot of the Tanggula Mountains.
The Yarlung Zangbo River traverses the southern part of ____.
One of the main rivers in western Tibet is ____.
One of the main rivers in eastern Tibet is ____.
Qinghai Lake is the largest ____ lake in China.
The northern Tibetan Plateau has numerous lakes, including Namucuo and ____.
The famous ____ lake is located in the basin on the northern slope of the Himalayas.
Mapang Yongcuo is a lake located in ____.
options: The northern slope basin of the Himalayas
answer: The northern slope basin of the Himalayas

question: The main mode of production in Tibetan areas is ____.
The characteristic of the Tibetan grassland area is ____.
Agriculture and ____ coexist in Tibetan areas, forming the main mode of production locally.
The natural environmental characteristics of the Tibetan region are____.
The economic development of Tibetan areas mainly relies on ____ and agriculture.
The main livestock of the Tibetan people includes Tibetan sheep, goats, yaks, and ____.
The specialty animals of the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau do not include ____.
The yak, known for its large body, long hair, cold resistance, and load-bearing capacity, is called ____.
Yaks not only provide meat but also serve as important ____.
options: means of transportation and draft power
specialty products of the Greater Khingan Mountains
answer: means of transportation and draft power

question: The fine horse breeds in Tibetan areas include Hequ horse, Datong horse, and ____.
The improved breed of mules in Tibetan areas is called ____.
Datong horses and Hequ horses are excellent breeds of horses in the ____ region.
____ belongs to the fine breeds of the Tibetan region.
Agriculture in Tibetan areas mainly focuses on planting ____ with a short growth period and strong resistance to cold and drought.
In Tibetan areas, there is also ____ crop cultivation.
In addition to barley, ____ is cultivated in Tibetan areas?
Some crops in Tibetan areas include wheat, peas, buckwheat, and ____.
Crops in Tibetan areas include wheat, highland barley, and ____.
In the warm parts of the southern valleys of the Tibetan region, ____ is also cultivated.
In the forests of the Tibetan region, there are ____ species.
There are ____ species in the forests of the Tibetan region.
There are ____ species in the forests of the Tibetan region.
There are ____ species in the forests of the Tibetan area.
The Tibetan ethnic group mainly resides in the vast middle and lower reaches of the Yarlung Zangbo River in ____, southeastern Qinghai, southern Gansu, and western Sichuan and Yunnan.
The Tibetan region has large areas of primeval forests, making it a famous ____ area in China.
The primeval forests in Tibetan areas are distributed in southeastern Qinghai, southern Gansu, and ____, western Yunnan.
The Tibetan regions include the vast areas of the middle and lower reaches of the Yarlung Tsangpo River in Tibet, southeastern Qinghai, southern Gansu, and western ____ in Sichuan.
Valuable medicinal materials produced in Tibetan regions include bear bile, musk, deer antler, and ____.
Among the precious animals inhabiting the Tibetan region are ____ and the northern plains gray langur.
The hydropower resources in Tibetan areas are very ____.
The Tibetan region has great potential for geothermal power generation. In addition, it also contains resources such as ____.
The natural resources in Tibetan areas include ____ , copper, iron, etc.
The inland lakes in Tibetan areas are rich in ____.
The inland lakes in the Tibetan areas are also rich in salt, ____ and natural soda.
The inland lakes in Tibetan areas are rich in natural resources, including salt and ____.
The Tibetan-inhabited area, the Qaidam Basin in Qinghai, and the ____ Plateau are also rich in oil resources.
The Northern Tibet Plateau and the Qaidam Basin in Qinghai are rich in ____ resources.
The Tibetan-inhabited areas include the ____ Basin in Qinghai.
The Qaidam Basin in Qinghai and the Northern Tibetan Plateau are Tibetan-inhabited areas, which are rich in ____.
In old society, the Tibetan ethnic group implemented a ____ system, which allowed the upper monk class not only to control people's ideology but also to control a large amount of land and livestock.
The theocratic system in the old Tibetan society allowed ____ to play an important role in social life.
Tibetan names are customarily ____.
options: Only given name without a surname
Only surname without a given name
answer: Only given name without a surname

question: Tibetan people's names usually have ____ characters.
Due to the high occurrence of duplicate names among Tibetans, they usually add ____ to distinguish names.
options: size descriptors (e.g., big or small) or personal characteristics
answer: size descriptors (e.g., big or small) or personal characteristics

question: In Tibetan culture, names are often derived from ____.
To distinguish people with the same name, Tibetans sometimes add ____ before their names.
options: Place of birth, place of residence, or personal occupation
answer: Place of birth, place of residence, or personal occupation

question: Tibetan nobles and Living Buddhas have ____ in front of their names.
The Tibetan Clan name is the title of ____.
The names of Tibetan noble houses ____ hold significance related to blood relations.
The names of Tibetan Living Buddhas may be preceded by a clan name, official title, or ____.
Tibetan men and women often keep ____ and like to wear accessories.
Tibetan men's hair is braided into a single braid and coiled on the ____ of their head.
Tibetan men and women both like to wear ____.
options: wool hats or fine leather hats
answer: wool hats or fine leather hats

question: In traditional Tibetan clothing, people wear ____ short jackets on the upper body.
The traditional outerwear of the Tibetan ethnic group is ____.
The right lapel of traditional Tibetan clothing is fastened with ____.
Some Tibetan rural women wear ____.
Tibetan robes are mostly made of ____ woven from wool.
The sleeveless long robes of the Tibetan people are mostly made of ____, a type of pulu fabric.

The sheepskin robe worn by Tibetan herdsmen is ____-sided.
Tibetan men and women wear ____ long boots or leather long boots.
Tibetan men wear ____ around their waists.
In Tibetan farming areas, women often wear a beautifully patterned apron around their waist, called ____ in Tibetan.
Tibetan people commonly use ____ as mats and cushions.
The quilts typically used by Tibetan people are____.
Another type of quilt that Tibetan people make is ____.
Tibetan people often expose ____ for ease of movement.
When Tibetans bare their arms, they will tie the ____ of their robes around their waist.
The Tibetan people's robes reach to ____.
Tibetan people loosen ____ when sleeping for comfort.
When Tibetan people sleep, their whole body can curl up in ____.
Tibetan people use long robes instead of ____.
The robes of Tibetan lamas are generally made of ____.
The color of Tibetan lamas' robes is usually ____.
Tibetan lamas wear ____ on their feet.
Tibetan lamas wear ____ on their heads.
Tibetan lamas wear ____ under their robes.
Hada is a special Tibetan ____.
When visiting guests, Tibetans present ____ with both hands as a sign of respect.
The staple food Tsampa in Tibetan farming areas is made into flour by grinding roasted ____ or peas, and is mixed with tea to eat.
In the Tibetan farming areas, the staple food mixed with tea is ____.
The Tsampa of the Tibetan people is mainly made from the flour ground from Qingke or ____.
In the traditional dietary habits of the Tibetan people, tsampa needs to be mixed with ____.
Tibetan people like ____.
The Tibetan people like to drink ____.
Tibetan butter tea is made by mixing butter with ____ in a special wooden barrel.
The staple food of the Tibetan pastoral area is ____.
When dining, the Tibetan people use portable utensils, including a wooden bowl and ____.
options: a short-handled pointed knife with a sheath
answer: a short-handled pointed knife with a sheath

question: When Tibetans dine, the wooden bowls and sheathed short-handled sharp knives they use are a type of ____.
Tibetans eat small portions at each meal. They usually have ____ meals a day.
Tibetan people like to drink ____.
Tibetan pastoral area women like to use ____ on their faces for skincare.

Tibetan monks can ____.
Tibetan farming areas mostly ____.
In Tibetan pastoral areas, people mostly use ____.
Tibetan houses have flat roofs and many windows, with simple and solid designs that reflect a strong ethnic character. They are mostly built on ____ high places, facing south from the north.
The traditional Tibetan houses are mostly ____ and have a strong ethnic style.
The design of Tibetan houses has the characteristic of ____.
Tibetan houses are usually built facing north to south and are often constructed on ____.
Tibetan houses generally use ____ to build walls.
The lower level of Tibetan houses is mostly used for ____.
The upper floor of Tibetan houses is generally used for____.
The shape of traditional Tibetan houses is usually ____.
Tibetan houses often have ____ indoors.
The tents commonly used in Tibetan pastoral areas are made of ____.
The color of the tents in Tibetan pastoral areas is usually____.
The rural courtyards of Tibetan villages are not only used for storing firewood but also for ____.
Most areas of the Tibetan ethnic group do not have the habit of eating ____.
Most Tibetan areas do not have the habit of eating ____.
Traditionally, Tibetan people do not eat ____ animal meat.
The hunting of Tibetans is mainly for obtaining ____.
In Tibetan culture, hunting is carried out to acquire valuable medicinal materials such as musk, antlers, and ____.
The main hall of Tibetan monastery architecture is usually ____.
The prayer wheels around Tibetan monasteries are usually spun by people in ____ direction.
In front of Tibetan monastery gates, large and small Buddhist stupas are usually built for burning ____ branches.
The architectural style of Tibetan monasteries is ____.
The splendid example of Tibetan architectural art is the ____ built on the Red Hill.
The golden roof of the Potala Palace gives people the impression of ____.
The Potala Palace is a brilliant example of ____ architectural art.
In Tibetan areas, traditional transportation mainly relies on ____ and mules/donkeys.
The traditional Tibetan water transportation tool is ____.
The Tibetan leather boat is made from a whole piece of ____ stitched together.
The keel of the Tibetan cowhide boat is made of ____.
The Tibetan people sometimes use ____ for water transportation.
In Tibetan areas, bridge forms include iron chain bridges, zip bridges, vine net bridges, and ____.
The unique Thangka painting style of the Tibetan culture mainly uses the ____ drawing technique.
The structure of Tibetan Thangka paintings is ____.
The colors of the pigments used in Tibetan Thangka paintings are ____.
The Tibetan Pulu is first made by spinning wool into yarn using a spindle made of ____.
The Tibetan Pulu is a fabric woven from ____.
The Tibetan pulu uses ____ made of wood and stone.
Tibetan people use stone mills or water mills to grind ____.
Tibetan butter is made using ____ to pound.
Tibetan side businesses include collecting ____.
Tibetan people collect medicinal herbs and ____ as part of their sideline activities.
In the secondary occupations of the Tibetan people, ____ is a common resource.
The Tibetan folk belief in Tibetan Buddhism is ____ Buddhism.
In Tibetan culture, the meaning of Lama in Tibetan is ____.
Buddhism was introduced to the Tibetan areas in the ___ century and absorbed the beliefs and rituals of the original Bon religion.
The Gelug school of Tibetan Buddhism is also known as ____ school.
In addition to the Nyingma school (Red sect), there is also the ____ school (Flower sect) in Tibetan areas.
In Tibetan areas, the Gelug school is referred to as ____ Buddhism.
Among the various schools of Tibetan Buddhism, the ____ school (Red School) is one of them.
The Kagyu sect of Tibetan Buddhism is also known as the ____ school.
The Gelug school of Tibetan Buddhism holds a ____ position in Tibetan culture.
In the Tibetan region, one of the famous monasteries in Lhasa is ____.
Sera Monastery is located in the Tibetan region of ____.
Drepung Monastery is one of the subordinate monasteries of the Tibetan ____ sect.
The Tashilhunpo Monastery is located in the Tibetan region of ____.
Galden Jampaling Monastery is a famous temple located in ____.
Labrang Monastery is located in ____ province.
The Ta'er Temple is a subordinate temple of the Tibetan Gelug sect, located in ____.
The system practiced in Tibetan Buddhism is ____.
options: The reincarnation system of Living Buddhas
answer: The reincarnation system of Living Buddhas

question: The first reincarnated Living Buddha in Tibet appeared as early as in the ____ century.
The reincarnation system of Living Buddhas in Tibetan culture was first established by____.
The reincarnation system of the Karma Kagyu lineage eventually formed ____ in Tibet.
In 1992, ____ approved the succession of the 17th Karmapa Lama.
options: Government of the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region

question: The 11th Panchen Lama Erdeni was reincarnated through ____.
In the western region of Tibet and the pastoral areas of Qinghai and Sichuan, the early religion in Tibetan areas that is still passed down is ____.
The Bon religion is commonly known as ____.
Bon religion is mainly practiced in the ____ region of the Tibetan areas.
The early religion of the Tibetan people was ____.
In Tibetan literature, a large number of cultural heritages are preserved, including the earliest ____.
Tibetan literature preserves a vast cultural heritage, with the earliest forms including scrolls, wooden slips, inscriptions on gold, and ____.
In Tibetan literature, in addition to scrolls, wooden tablets, and inscriptions, there is also ____ as a way of preserving cultural heritage.
The block printing technology of the Tibetan people was introduced from ____.
The Ganjuur and Danjuur are famous ____.
Early Tibetan literature includes the medical masterpiece "____".
Princess Wencheng is the ____ of the Tibetan ethnic group.
The Epic of King Gesar is known as the world's longest ____.
Tibetan legend novels include 'The Life of Milarepa' and '____'.
options: The Love Songs of Tsangyang Gyatso

question: The Potala Palace is an important ____ place for Tibetans.
One of the important religious sites of the Tibetan ethnic group is ____.
Sakya Monastery is a place of ____ for Tibetans.
The Tibetan Branch of the Buddhist Association of China was established and publishes the Tibetan periodical "____".
The Tibetan Buddhist Academy was established by the Tibet Branch of the China ____ Association.
The country established the China Tibetan Language ____ in Beijing, specifically to train high-level talents in Tibetan Buddhism.
In the process of diagnosis and treatment, Tibetan medicine emphasizes methods such as ____.
options: fumigation, sitting medication, bloodletting, hot and cold compresses
cauterization, hot compress, covering with animal skins, ligation

question: The Tibetan ethnic group uses their own calendar based on ____, yin and yang, and the twelve zodiac animals for keeping track of years.
The Tibetan calendar marks the years using the five elements, ____ and the twelve zodiac animals.
The Tibetan calendar includes the ____ system used to record years.
The Tibetan calendar year is divided into ____.
The Tibetan calendar has ____ months in a year.
In the Tibetan calendar, a long month has ____ days.
In the Tibetan calendar, a short month has ____ day.
According to the Tibetan calendar, generally, a leap month is inserted every ____ year(s).
The Tibetan calendar calculations are precise and can predict ____.
___ is one of the dance forms of Tibetan group dance.
Tibetan religious musical instruments are usually mainly____.
The unique tug-of-war competition of the Tibetan people is called ____.
The Thangka painting technique mainly focuses on meticulous brushwork and ____.
Tibetan carving art can be divided into court carving and ____ carving.
The characteristics of Tibetan court carving are____.
The characteristics of Tibetan folk carving are ____.
The folk carving style of the Tibetan people is simple and ____.
Compared to Tibetan folk carvings, Tibetan court carvings are more ____.
Tibetan folk carvings are commonly seen on____.
The folk carving of the Tibetan people embodies more of the charm of ____.
Tibetan folk carvings are often seen on scripture boards, mani stones, rocks, ancient buildings, and ____.
Tibetan opera is a unique form of ____.
The accompaniment of Tibetan opera performances mainly consists of ____.
The Tibetan opera costumes consist of only ____ set(s) from head to toe.
Tibetan opera actors do not ____.
Tibetan opera actors mainly wear ____ to perform.
In some Tibetan areas, the practice of ____ involves taking the corpse to a celestial burial site in the mountains to be dismembered and cut.
In the Tibetan sky burial ceremony, the bones of the corpse are also ____ to feed the vultures.
Most Tibetans wear a metal ____ on their chest.
Tibetan monasteries are equipped with ____ both inside and outside.
Tibetans should not ____ the fire pit, etc.
Tibetans must not ____ religious instruments.
Tibetan people must not turn prayer wheels and prayer barrels ____.
____ is not a traditional Tibetan festival.
The Tibetan Saga Dawa Festival is a ____.
Ongkor Festival is the traditional ______ of the Tibetan ethnic group.
On the Tibetan New Year (Losar), Tibetan people dress in traditional festive attire and ____ each other.
The Tibetan New Year is the most important ____ for the Tibetan people.
On the Tibetan New Year's Day, Tibetan people go to ____ to worship and pray for blessings.
On the evening of the fifteenth day of the Tibetan New Year, households will light up ____.
In places like Kumbum Monastery in Qinghai and Jokhang Temple in Lhasa, the lamas use butter to create ____, which are colorful and intricately sculpted.
The characteristic of butter sculptures is that the colors are ____.
The Tibetan people commemorate the day believed to be the enlightenment of ____ on the fifteenth day of the fourth month.
The Tibetan people celebrate the day ____ arrived in Tibet on April 15th.
The Ongkor Festival of the Tibetan people is in ____.
The Tibetan Ongkor Festival is to pray for ____.
options: A good harvest for the year
answer: A good harvest for the year

question: The event held by Tibetans in July is called the ____ Festival.
